parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "runtime": "10 hours",
    "account": "imi@v100",
    "job_name": "PPO_GTL4_%a",
    "nodes": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 20,
    "gpus_per_node": 1,
    "output_logs": "slurm_logs/PPO_GTL4_%a.out",
    "error_logs": "slurm_logs/PPO_GTL4_%a.err",
    "array_tasks": 2,
    "qos": "qos_gpu-t3",
    "node_type": "v100-32g",
    "python_version": "3.8.2",
    "conda_environment": "dlp",
    "script_to_run": "scripts/train_ppo_baseline.sh",
    "environment_variables": {
      "SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID": "array task ID"
    },
    "script_arguments": [
      "BabyAI-GoToLocalS8N4-v0",
      "GTL4",
      "6",
      "${SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID}"
    ]
  }
}
```

The script is running under the **SLURM** workload manager. It is configured to run for 10 hours on a single node with 20 CPUs and a single GPU. It requires the Python version 3.8.2 and the conda environment named "dlp". The script executes the command `scripts/train_ppo_baseline.sh BabyAI-GoToLocalS8N4-v0 GTL4 6 ${SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID}`.

The script utilizes a number of SLURM directives to configure the job:

* `--time`: specifies the maximum runtime of the job
* `--account`: identifies the account that will be charged for the job
* `--job-name`: sets the name of the job
* `--ntasks-per-node`: specifies the number of tasks to run per node
* `--nodes`: specifies the number of nodes to use for the job
* `--cpus-per-task`: specifies the number of CPUs to allocate to each task
* `--gres`: requests access to GPUs
* `--hint`: provides hints to the scheduler about how to allocate resources
* `-o`: specifies the output file for the job
* `-e`: specifies the error file for the job
* `--array`: runs multiple instances of the job in an array
* `--qos`: specifies the quality of service level for the job
* `-C`: specifies the node type to use

The script also uses the `module` command to load the required software packages.

Finally, the script uses the `srun` command to execute the `train_ppo_baseline.sh` script. 

This script seems to be designed to train a reinforcement learning model using the PPO algorithm. The arguments passed to the `train_ppo_baseline.sh` script specify the environment (`BabyAI-GoToLocalS8N4-v0`), the experiment name (`GTL4`), the number of training steps (`6`), and the array task ID (`${SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID}`).
